en: Message from the Minister of Education and Human Resources I am glad to be able to present to the population another milestone in the process of giving to Kreol Morisien its ‘lettres de noblesse’
cr: Mesaz Minis Ledikasion ek Resours Imin Mo bien kontan pou prezant popilasion morisien ankor enn letap inportan dan nou demars pou donn Kreol Morisien so ‘lettres de noblesse’

en: This publication on the grammar of Kreol Morisien is in fact one of the three props on which the whole edifice of the full standardization process of the language rests
cr: Sa piblikasion lor gramer Kreol Morisien la, li an fet enn parmi sa trwa pilie lor ki tou sa gran travay standardizasion lang kreol la repoze

en: We had already gained massive unanimity on the orthography of the language and we also have the new editions of the Diksioner Morisien , both of which are already proving to be useful to many of us
cr: Nou finn deza gagn linanimite pou lortograf lang la e nou ena osi nouvo edision Diksioner Morisien

en: Many amongst us found how useful using both languages are
cr: Bokou parmi nou finn fer lexperyans litilite toule-de

en: Giving the language its credentials has not always been easy—but the fact that this has been successfully done goes to prove that , with good will and the adoption of a broader and dispassionate outlook, what was impossible yesterday can and has become possible today
cr: Donn enn lang so bann referans pa finn touzour fasil – me le fet ki sa demars la finn fer avek sikse montre ki seki ti inposib yer kapav vinn e finn vinn posib zordi, kan ena bonn volonte ek finn adopte enn pe respektiv pli larz ek rasionel

en: In this context, I must thank Dr. Daniella Police-Michel and the members of her Working Group on Grammar as well as all the members of the Akademi Kreol Morisien for their unflagging efforts to ensure that becomes a watershed year for our education system with the formal introduction of the mother tongue, Kreol Morisien, into schools
cr: Dan sa kontext-la, mo bizin remersie Dr Daniella Police-Michel ek bann manb so ‘working group’ lor gramer, osi bien ki tou bann manb Akademi Kreol Morisien pou zot zefor konstan pou asire ki mark enn tournan desizif pou nou sistem edikat if avek introdiksion ofisiel nou lang maternel, Kreol Morisien , dan bann lekol

en: I must also thank the Government of which I am a proud office bearer for having had the foresight to do the right thing at the right time and in the right context
cr: Mo bizin osi remersie Gouvernma pou ki mo fier ki mo enn minis, parski li finn ena klervwayans pou fer seki ti bizin kan ti bizin fer li ek dan kontext kot ti bizin fer li

en: My Ministry is deeply committed to striving for a better tomorrow for all our learners so that the country can move on to even greater heights
cr: Mo Minister finn angaz li pou fer tou zefor neseser pou amenn enn landemin meyer pou bann zelev ek etidian, pou ki pei kapav progrese ver enn lavenir touzour pli gran

en: Message from the Minister of Education and Human Resources It is with immense pleasure th at I present today to the entire population of Mauritius this first document produced by the Akademi Kreol Morisien (AKM) entitled “Lortograf Kreol Morisien”
cr: Mesaz Minis Ledikasion ek Resours Imin Se avek enn gran plezir ki mo pe prezant premie dokiman, ki apel Lortgraf Kreol Morisien, ki Akademi Kreol Morisien finn prodir pou popilasion Moris an entier

en: This document represents the collective effort of a dedicated group that has for long been militating for the establishment of Kreol Morisien as an official language and for the introduction of Kreol Morisien into the classroom
cr: Sa dokiman-la reprezant zefor kolektif enn group dimounn devwe, ki pa finn aret milite pou ki Kreol Morisien vinn enn lang ofisiel e ki li rant dan lekol

en: The government in which I have the pleasure and honour to serve as a State Minister has made it a crucial part of its policy to give this language its legitimate place in the education system
cr: Mo ena plezir ek loner fer parti enn gouvernman ki konsider introdiksion Kreol Morisien kouma enn priorite et sa montre ki nou krwar ki sa langaz-la ena so plas lezitim dan lekol

en: This is not so much because it will merely help our pupils to better apprehend concepts and knowledge, but principally because a mother tongue needs to be ascribed its due credentials
cr: Pa zis parski li pou donn enn koudme nou bann zanfan konpran bann konsep, me prinsipalman parski nou krwar ki li nou devwar donn tou rekonesans enn langaz maternel

en: I distinctly recall the National Forum that my Ministry organized on the subject on August
cr: Mo bien rapel Forum Nasional ki mo Minister ti or ganize lor sa size-la le Out

en: This was a historic moment - a groundbreaking achievement in that it rallied a number of individuals and organizations together with everyone reading from the same song script - all realizing that the time had come for the language to occupy a place of pride in our educational system and working consensually towards it
cr: Li ti enn moman istorik, enn lavansman exsepsionel parski nou ti resi rasanble boukou dimounn ek lorganizasion ki finn deside ki ler finn arive pou ki nou tou marye-pike ek donn langaz-la so plas lezitim dan nou sistem edikatif

en: This first printed edition of “Lortograf Kreol Morisien” is a reference for all those who will further contribute to preparing the way for the in troduction of the language as an optional subject in schools
cr: Sa premie edision “Lortograf Kreol Morisien” la, li enn referans pou tou bann ki pou kontign kontribie pou tras sime pou fer Kreol Morisien rant dan lekol kouma enn size opsionel

en: The document will also help all of us to write a standardized Kreol Morisien
cr: Li ousi enn dokiman ki pou permet nou tou ekrir enn Kreol Morisen standardize

en: But this “Lortograf Kreol Morisien” is just the beginning
cr: Me “Lortograf Kreol Morisien”, li zis enn koum ansman

en: There are other facets of the language that the Akademi is working on that relate to the grammar as well the production of curricular materials while in parallel the mounting of teacher training programs will soon be seeing the light of day
cr: Ena plizier lezot faset langaz-la ki pankor trouv lizour,  lakademi ankor pe travay lor gramer, prodiksion materyel kurikulum ek ousi, montaz program formasion pou bann profeser.

en: Language is part of a culture
cr: Tou langaz fer parti enn kiltir

en: It is also a reflection of an identity
The beauty of Kreol Morisien is that it belongs to no single ethnic group of Mauritius but to everyone
cr: Bote Kreol Morisien se ki li pa apartenir a enn sel group etnik dan Moris me ki li pou tou dimounn

en: It is ultimately part and parcel of the Mauritan way of life, of the Mauritian psyche
cr: E parski li fer parti nou manier viv, nou sikolozi, li donn nou enn lidantite kolektif ousi

en: As such it provides a collective identity as well, allowing all of us to seek, secure and sustain our roots in it
cr: Sa permet nou tou retrouv, konsolid ek fer nou rasinn avanse

en: So kudos to all who over the decades have been engaged in the laudable endeavour to give the language its sound foundations
cr: Donk, sapo a tou bann dimounn ki, depi plizier banane, finn fer enn gran travay pou donn Kreol Morisien enn fondasion solid

en: Building the edifice is now the responsibility of the AKM
cr: Zordi se AKM ki ena responsabilite kontign konstriksion-la

en: I wish accordingly to put on record my sincere appreciation to all members of the AKM and all those who collaborated in the Working Group to provide a concise validated writing system for Kreol Morisien
cr: Les mo dir donk mo sinser apresiasion a tou bann manb Akademi e tou bann dimounn ki finn kolabor dan Group-travay ki finn permet nou gagn enn sistem presi, standardize pou lekritir Kreol Morisien

en: Do keep up the good work - you have the blessings of the entire nation
cr: Kontign zot bon travay – lepep Morisien beni zot

en: Preface from Chairperson, AKM The creation of the Mauritian Kreol Academy in October represents an important historical stage in the process of recognition, development and pr omotion of our country’s language
cr: Prefas Prezidan AKM Kreasion Akademi Kreol Morisien an Oktob reprezant enn letap istorik inportan dan rekonesans, devlopman ek promosion lang nou pei

en: In accordance with its terms of reference as established by Government, the Mauritian Kreol Academy will advise on the: • Standardization of Mauritian Kreol including pronunciation, syntax and grammar; • Validation of the writing system; • Provision of necessary technical guidelines for the development of curriculum materials and training to teachers; and • Promotion and development of the language
cr: Selon bann term referans ki Gouvernman finn etabli, Akademi Kreol Morisien pou fer bann propozision lor : • standardizasion Kreol Morisien so prononsiasion, sintax ek gramer; • validasion so lortograf; • definision bann prinsip teknik ki pou gid travay preparasion bann liv ek lezot materyo kurikulum ek travay formasion bann profeser Kreol Morisien; • promosion ek devlopman lang Kreol Morisien

en: The launching of the Mauritian Kreol Academy on October by the Minister of Education and Human Resources, Hon  Dr Vasant Bunwaree
cr: Akademi Kreol Morisien so lansman ti fer le Oktob par Minis Ledikasion ek Resours Imin, Lonorab Dr Vasant Bunwaree

en: The same day Academy held its first meeting during which technical committees were set up to work on the objectives assigned to the Academy as per its terms of reference
cr: Mem zour, Akademi ti fer so premie renion pou kre bann komite teknik lor bann tem ki form parti so term referans

en: The Technical Committee on validation of Mauritian Kreol Orthography, chaired by Dr Arnaud Carpooran, submitted its first document to the Academy for discussion at its nd meeting held on November
cr: Komite Teknik Validasion Lortograf Kreol Morisien, prezide par Dr Arnaud Carpooran, ti soumet enn premie dokiman ki Akademi ti konsidere dan so em renion le Novam

en: This was followed by a special meeting of the Academy on December during which Dr Carpooran presented the final draft document on Mauritian Kreol Orthography, members present expressed their appreciation of the work done by the Committee
cr: Apre sa finn ena enn renion spesial le Desam, akot Dr Carpooran ti prezant so draf final, e bann manb Akademi ti exprim zot apresiasion

en: On behalf of the Mauritian Kreol Academy, I am pleased to present the final document on the orthography of Mauritian Kreol written by Dr Carpoo ran as chairperson of the Technical Committee
cr: O-nom Akademi Kreol Morisien, mo ena plezir prezant Rapor Final lor Lortograf Kreol Morisien ki Dr Carpooran finn redize antan ki prezidan Komite Validasion Lortograf

en: It is worth keeping in mind that this document is also the outcome of the considerable work done since the late s and which produced several standardized writing systems for Mauritian Kreol until recently
cr: Deryer sa dokiman- la, li bon rapel ki ena enn travay konsiderab ki ti koumanse ver lafin bann lane e ki finn prodir plizier grafi standardize pou ekrir Kreol Mo risien ziska tou resaman

en: Then, in , a first government initiative on this issue led to the setting up of a UoM-MIE committee under my responsibility in view of harmonizing these various standardized writing systems
cr: An , pou premie fwa, gouvernman morisien pran linisiativ pou etablir enn grafi standar komin, enn komite Liniversite Moris-MIE plase sou mo responsabilite finn travay lor enn sintez bann diferan grafi standardize pou prodir Grafi-larmoni

en: In my Report on the proposal for a harmonized writing system, it is underlined that the proposed Grafi- larmoni “is not a closed system” and that it “will evolve with time and pract ice”
cr: Dan mo Rapor lor Grafi-larmoni, li kler ki sa nouvo lortograf-la pa enn sistem ferme, e ki nou pou bizin teste li dan lapratik

en: Punctuation problems were also highlighted, as a result of which a recommendation was included for a follow up by technical committee
cr: Ena osi bann lezot laspe teknik kouma ponktiasion ki bizin re- examine, akoz samem nou ti fer enn rekomandasion pou met dibout enn komite teknik pou reget sa bann problem-la

en: In the meantime, Dr Arnaud Carpooran together with his team of students and collaborators was in the field, testing Grafi-larmoni in the context of the elaboration of the first Mauritian monolingual dictionary
cr: Antretan, Dr Arnaud Carpooran, avek so lekip etidian ek kolaborater, finn teste Grafi-larmoni lor terin, dan kad preparasion premie diksioner morisien monoleng

en: Its publication in was a historical landmark in the development of Mauritian Kreol; in the same process, Grafi-larmoni, the orthography adopted with the necessary improvements, obtained due recognition and legitimacy
cr: Nou finn gagn enn diksioner ki reprezant enn lavansman istorik pou lang nou pei; anmemtan, lortograf ki ti servi, Grafi-larmoni, avek bann retous ek bann ameliorasion neseser, finn gagn so veritab rekonesans lezitim

en: The Mauritian Kreol Academy wishes to express its gr ateful thanks to Dr Carpooran, to the members of the Mauritian Kreol Orthography Validation Committee, and also to the team of students and collaborators, for having pursued further the already considerable scientific and professional work done so far, in order to offer to the Academy its first document produced in the context of the mandate entrusted to it by Government
cr: Akademi Kreol Morisien exprim so remersiman ek so rekonsesans anver Dr Carpooran ek bann manb Komite Validasion Lortograf, e osi so lekip etidian ek kolaborater, ki finn prolonz sa travay siantifik ek profesionel deza konsiderab, pou ofer Akademi Kreol Morisien so premie dokiman dan kad mision ki Gouvernman finn konfie li

en: Published by the Government Printing, it proudly displays the coat of arms of the Republic of Mauritius
cr: Piblie par Linprimri Gouvernman, Lortograf Kreol Morisien port lanblem nasional Repiblik Moris

en: Give one other way to kill the germs in filtered water
cr: Donn enn lot fason pou touy mikrob dan delo filtre

en: How each child is caring for his/her pet animal
cr: Kouma sak zanfan pe pran so zanimo swin

en: I prepare two potted plants of the same type
cr: Mo pre par/pran de plant dan po

en: It is a bad habit to talk while eating
cr: Li pa enn bon labitid koze labous plin

en: My ears are my sense of hearing
My hands are my sense of touch
Sight, hearing, smell, taste and touch
